thread.title: Twitter reacts: Arsenal's astonishing defeat at Bayern Munich leaves social media users in raptures

author: Callum Rice-Coates
title: Twitter reacts: Arsenal's astonishing defeat at Bayern Munich leaves social media users in raptures
text: Twitter reacts: Arsenal's astonishing defeat at Bayern Munich leaves social media users in raptures Callum Rice-Coates Share View photos Arsenal, perhaps unsurprisingly by now, fell to a heavy 5-1 defeat against Bayern Munich at the Allianz Arena in the first leg of the Champions League last 16 on Wednesday night. An excellent Arjen Robben goal put the Bundesliga champions in front, before Alexis Sanchez levelled before the break to leave Arsenal in a seemingly reasonable position. But a capitulation in the second half, mixed with an excellent display of attacking football from the home side, allowed a brace from Thiago and a... More Arsenal, perhaps unsurprisingly by now, fell to a heavy 5-1 defeat against Bayern Munich at the Allianz Arena in the first leg of the Champions League last 16 on Wednesday night. An excellent Arjen Robben goal put the Bundesliga champions in front, before Alexis Sanchez levelled before the break to leave Arsenal in a seemingly reasonable position. But a capitulation in the second half, mixed with an excellent display of attacking football from the home side, allowed a brace from Thiago and a Robert Lewandowski to take the game, and perhaps the tie, out of reach. View photos
